channel.title: Connection Problems
channel.description:
Hey all, i've been coding rsps' for around 4 years now and i've never had this problem with no-ip or any other dynamic/static hosting.
It seems since i've had a new modem, connections through no-ip are failing. Checking my ports, it says the connections through port: 5555 are working as they should, nothing is blocking it. Yet the client cannot connect to the server. The ports are correct in the server files yet the only error i can think of is No-Ip.
The host name is correct and the program is already allowed to run through my firewall, i even turned it off to see if it was my computers firewall, but no luck.
Does anyone here know a fix for this problem?

item.title: Connection Problems
item.dc:creator: @tyb97 tyb97
item.description:
@tyb97 wrote:

[quote=“ultimatepkvillage, post:6, topic:423435”][quote author=teh one link=topic=526068.msg3831213#msg3831213 date=1322596518]
I don’t want Local Host, theres a few developing and its easier to have access when its globally online. The whole reason why its no-ip.
[/quote]

You have to use localhost otherwise it will keep saying error connecting to server, other people use no-ip to connect to your server

[size=8pt]> LMAO DUDE, NO-IP IS FOR OTHERS TO CONNECT < [/size][/quote]
Your retarted.

But teh one, canyouseeme.org, and try another port, and make a new host to try and fix this issue, I have seen it before.

Read full topic

item.title: Connection Problems
item.dc:creator: @teh_one teh one
item.description:
@teh_one wrote:

No-ip can also be used as Local Host, as my 474 clients runs through it hosted on this computer. Also its not connecting for others, the port forwarding is all correct.

Read full topic

It seems since i’ve had a new modem, connections through no-ip are failing. Checking my ports, it says the connections through port: 5555 are working as they should, nothing is blocking it.
